text.p: Australian Provincial Newspapers Holdings Ltd (APN) said on Thursday it had acquired the Australian Posters outdoor advertising division from 3M Australia Ltd for an undisclosed sum.
APN group finance director Vincent Crowley later told Reuters that Australian Posters had annual sales of about A$26 million but would not reveal profit results.
The division would add to APN's two other outdoor advertising units, he said.
APN said the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission was comfortable that the purchase did not breach the Trade Practices Act.
3M announced in the United States last week that it would sell its U.S.-based outdoor advertising unit called National Advertising Co for US$1 billion to Outdoor Systems Inc.
3M chief executive Harold Laskin said the Australian sale was not related to the U.S. divestment.

APN is a regional newspaper publisher which is 49 percent-owned by Irish media group Independent Newspapers Plc and the family interests of Irish businessman Tony O'Reilly. His son, Cameron, is the managing director of APN.
